intro: Amphicosmia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited amphicosmia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white to yellowish flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Amphicosmia macrocarpa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within forest understories.
